page.title: 11THROWLEY LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: Local government in Throwley is admin istered by the Kent County Council. Local affairs are considered by the parish council.An extra penny rate pays for local projects. Recent work has included a wooden seat at the Forstal and a new notice board.Some of the silver birch trees have been thinned out,and pot holes filled in paths after the severe winter.The proposal to erect a lamp at the Park Terrace car park was rejected because of the cost.The village was entered for The Best Kept Village competition,but was unplaced. Local applications for planning permission are considered by the parish council.No new buildings are permitted in the conservation area. Problems considered have been the stubble burning by farmers,and the aerial spraying of crops.
